title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age, depicting the excess and tragedy of the American dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, following Captain Ahabâ€™s pursuit of the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A timeless romantic novel about love, class, and societal expectations in 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel that captures teenage angst and alienation through the experiences of Holden Caulfield.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic dystopian novel that explores the consequences of state control, technology, and consumerism.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A beloved fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins on a quest to reclaim a lost kingdom.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping historical novel that intertwines the lives of several families during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A gripping psychological novel that delves into the mind of a man who commits a crime and struggles with guilt.
